summary: Dark Matter Podcast 019 - Cyberpunk 2077, Spider-Man y Nintendo Direct
title: Dark Matter Podcast 019 - Cyberpunk 2077, Spider-Man y Nintendo Direct
excerpt: ¡El #podcast más aburrido de la supercarretera de la información regresa! Y esta vez 200% más aburrido ya que hablamos de temas viejos porque no habíamos grabado podcast en un mes: Cyberpunk 2077, Spider-Man, Los Nintendos, Red Dead Redemption 2, Death Stranding y el colapso absoluto de Telltale Games Además anunciamos regalitos para las próximas semanas. Bienvenidos al Dark Matter Podcast 019 http://bit.ly/DMPIV019

Cyberpunk 2077 news hits this week, as WB picks up distribution
 Warner Bros will be picking up the distribution of CD Projekt...
caption:
Cyberpunk 2077 news hits this week, as WB picks up distribution

Warner Bros will be picking up the distribution of CD Projekt Red’s Cyberpunk 2077. Though there’s still no release date for the game. Punked Well, this is good news, since things are clearly moving forward on Cyberpunk 2077. The game has seemingly been in development forever, and…

title: Saving punk from Cyberpunk
excerpt: "How cyberpunk is Cyberpunk 2077?" is the question many of the game's detractors have been asking, often with reference to its handling of trans representat…
description:
There’s not a whole lot of transgressiveness thus far in Cyberpunk 2077. Instead, there are implants that make you a better fighter, infiltrator and hacker, branching dialogue paths, main and optional objectives, level-ups and a banquet of lavishly modelled weapons - all the customary fittings of an open world RPG, swimming beneath a crust of comfortably cyberpunk atmospheric cues such as chrome skinwear, overcompensatory neoslang and sexbots on billboards. It seems the game you’d expect from a publicly traded software company worth over two billion dollars, one that is, like Bethke, basically looking to combine known quantities in a flashy way rather than break things, and in that regard, of course, it’s part of a very old cycle.

“Ultimately, what we see over and over is that people within dominant ideologies appropriate from these aesthetics and [their work] becomes the point of conversation in its stead,” says Matilde Park, co-owner of Toronto, Canada-based studio Aether Interactive. “I think that happens all the time - look at cyberpunk. What does cyberpunk really mean to AAA corporations owned by other, bigger corporations making multimillion dollar fantasies within its aesthetics? Apparently, it means body modifications that don’t change the body in any transgressive way; pervasive, overwhelming corporate dominance that is passively accepted as a fact of life. In a sense, when dominant ideologies appropriate the aesthetics of these movements, they’re defanged, they’re the same sort of narratives we see over and over. I think they’re inherently less interesting stories, and I think that’s why the movements begin to ‘die.’” It’s just as well, then, that there’s more to videogame punk and cyberpunk than blockbuster games. Park and her colleagues are part of a cluster of developers - many of them queer, trans and indigenous people - who are learning from or embracing punk not just for its flavour but for the traditions and techniques it embodies.

There’s not a whole lot of transgressiveness thus far in Cyberpunk 2077. Instead, there are implants that make you a better fighter, infiltrator and hacker, branching dialogue paths, main and optional objectives, level-ups and a banquet of lavishly modelled weapons - all the customary fittings of an open world RPG, swimming beneath a crust of comfortably cyberpunk atmospheric cues such as chrome skinwear, overcompensatory neoslang and sexbots on billboards. summary: I know the ‘travel to the moon’ rumour is kinda old, but the whole idea of that would be sooo cool! Maybe it’s a once-off...
body: I know the ‘travel to the moon’ rumour is kinda old, but the whole idea of that would be sooo cool! Maybe it’s a once-off mission or a full area you can travel to at will. It seems ideal for an end game area, (imagine having a apartment on the moon like damn). There are moon colonies in Cyberpunk 2020 lore and those shots in the trailer that had it so it seems pretty likely

reblog.comment: I know the ‘travel to the moon’ rumour is kinda old, but the whole idea of that would be sooo cool! Maybe it’s a once-off mission or a full area you can travel to at will. summary: Warner Bros izdaje Cyberpunk 2077 u Severnoj Americi
title: Warner Bros izdaje Cyberpunk 2077 u Severnoj Americi
body:
Warner Bros izdaje Cyberpunk 2077 u Severnoj Americi

CD Projekt Red obnavlja partnerstvo sa kompanijom Warner Bros koje je prvi put sklopila pre nekoliko godina za potrebe izdavanja The Witcher 2 i 3 igara na teritoriji Severne Amerike.

Ova dva giganta se sada ponovo udružuju kako bi nadolazeću pucačinu u prvom licu, Cyberpunk 2077, doveli na istu teritoriju.

Ovom prilikom je vođa biznis segmenta CD Projekt Red izjavio: “Sarađivali smo sa Warner…

View On WordPress

summary: Do you think we’ll be able to join a gang in Cyberpunk 2077? And if we can, can we hold gang meet-ups or something?? Like, go...
body:
Do you think we’ll be able to join a gang in Cyberpunk 2077? And if we can, can we hold gang meet-ups or something?? Like, go get drinks or host a raid or go bowling?

What if we can join the Valentino’s and Jackie gives us an initiation mission or something? Dating sim mini game could you imagine!

reblog.comment:

summary: Milliárdokat követel a nagy sikerű The Witcher írója
title: Milliárdokat követel a nagy sikerű The Witcher írója
body:
Milliárdokat követel a nagy sikerű The Witcher írója

A The Witcher univerzumát a könyveivel megalkotó Andrzej Sapkowski író már megbánta, hogy egyszeri fizetséget fogadott el történetéért a CD Projekttől.

A CD Projekt még a kétezres évek elején kereste meg az írót azzal, hogy szeretné megvásárolni a The Witcherjátékadaptációjának exkluzív készítési jogát. A cég eredetileg felajánlotta Sapkowskinak, hogy az elkészült játékok eladásai után fizetne…

View On WordPress
